00054 /*****************************************************************************\
00055  * NOTICE OF CONVENTION                                                      *
00056  * ------------------------------------------------------------------------- *
00057  * Mspec links to Pcode, Hcode, and Lcode modules.  In order to allow this   *
00058  * to take place without requiring front-end modules to link to liblcode.a,  *
00059  * Mspec code is divided into two classes as follows:                        *
00060  *  - mi_*.c must not depend on linkage to liblcode.a                        *
00061  *  - ml_*.c may depend on linkage to liblcode.a                             *
00062 \*****************************************************************************/
00063

00213 /*
00214  *      define the natural integer size.
00215  *      bit fields will be converted into integer
00216  *      operations.
00217  */
00218 
00219 #define M_SIZE_LLONG            64
00220 #define M_ALIGN_LLONG           64
00221 #define M_SIZE_INT              32
00222 #define M_ALIGN_INT             32
00223 #define M_SIZE_CHAR              8
00224 
00225 /*
00226  *      assumption 1: all pointers have the same properties.
00227  *      assumption 2: unsigned & signed types have the same properties.
00228  *      assumption 3: a function is simply a address == a pointer.
00229  */
00230 #define M_TYPE_VOID             0       /* void */
00231 #define M_TYPE_CHAR             1       /* char, unsigned char */
00232 #define M_TYPE_SHORT            2       /* short, unsigned short */
00233 #define M_TYPE_INT              3       /* int, unsigned int */
00234 #define M_TYPE_LONG             4       /* long, unsigned long */
00235 #define M_TYPE_LLONG            5       /* long long, unsigned long long */
00236 #define M_TYPE_FLOAT            6       /* float, unsigned float */
00237 #define M_TYPE_DOUBLE           7       /* double, unsigned double */
00238 #define M_TYPE_POINTER          8       /* char *, void *, ... */
00239 #define M_TYPE_UNION            9       /* union {} */
00240 #define M_TYPE_STRUCT           10      /* struct {} */
00241 #define M_TYPE_BLOCK            11      /* array */
00242 #define M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR         12      /* char:1 */
00243 #define M_TYPE_BIT_SHORT        13      /* short:1 */
00244 #define M_TYPE_BIT_INT          14      /* int:1 */
00245 #define M_TYPE_BIT_LONG         15      /* long int:1 */
00246 #define M_TYPE_BIT_LLONG        16      /* long long int:1 */
00247 
00248 #define M_TYFL_HFA_SGL          1       /* homogeneous floating point aggr */
00249 #define M_TYFL_HFA_DBL          2       /* homogeneous floating point aggr */
00250 #define M_TYFL_HFA              3       /* homogeneous floating point aggr */
00251 
00252 typedef struct _struct_M_Type
00253 {
00254   int type;                     /* type of a variable */
00255   int unsign;                   /* unsigned type */
00256   int align;                    /* its alignment requirement (in bits) */
00257   int size;                     /* minimum size it needs (in bits) */
00258   int nbits;                    /* for M_TYPE_BIT only */
00259   int flags;
00260 }
00261 _M_Type, *M_Type;
00262

00297 /*
00298  * Fields of a union can be aligned to the lower address
00299  * or to the higher address of the allocated space.
00300  * offset is specified relative to the lower address of the data block.
00301  * XXX_layout() determines the offset of fields.
00302  * XXX_align() returns the alignment requirement of the overall structure.
00303  * XXX_size() returns the minimum storage requirement of the overall structure.
00304  */
00305   extern void M_array_layout (M_Type type, int *offset);
00306   extern int M_array_align (M_Type type);
00307   extern int M_array_size (M_Type type, int dim);
00308 
00309   extern void M_union_layout (int n, _M_Type * type, int *offset,
00310                               int *bit_offset, char *union_name,
00311                               char *field_name[]);
00312 
00313   extern int M_union_align (int n, _M_Type * type, char *union_name);
00314   extern int M_union_size (int n, _M_Type * type, char *union_name);
00315 
00316   extern void M_struct_layout (int n, _M_Type * type, int *base,
00317                                int *bit_offset, char *struct_name,
00318                                char *field_name[]);
00319   extern int M_struct_align (int n, _M_Type * type, char *struct_name);
00320   extern int M_struct_size (int n, _M_Type * type, int struct_align,
00321                             char *struct_name);

00331 #define M_THRU_MEMORY                   1
00332 #define M_INDIRECT_THRU_REGISTER        2       /* a pointer to a structure */
00333 #define M_INDIRECT_THRU_MEMORY          3       /* a pointer to a structure */

00337 #define M_PUT_FNVAR             2       /* outgoing parameter frame setup */
00338 #define M_RET_FNVAR             3       /* return value setup             */
